subject: Communication
title: Stories vs. Statistics: What Persuades?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Stories vs. Statistics: What Persuades?.

hook.text: One dying child raises millions. The statistic '10 million children at risk' raises a fraction. Why?

buildup.text: Psychologist Paul Slovic calls it 'psychic numbing' â€” our empathy doesn't scale with numbers.

discovery.text: A single story activates emotional processing. Large numbers activate analytical processing, which suppresses emotion.

twist.text: Adding statistics to a personal story actually reduces charitable giving. Numbers dilute the emotion.

climax.text: The most effective communicators lead with one human story, then â€” only then â€” introduce the bigger picture.

punchline.text: One story beats a thousand stats. Every time.

quiz.question: What is 'psychic numbing'?
options: Our empathy failing to scale with large statistics
